Tool

NameSlope Limited Flow Accumulation
ID26
AuthorO.Conrad (c) 2014
Specificationgrid

Description

Flow accumulation is calculated as upslope contributing (catchment) area using the multiple flow direction approach of Freeman (1991). For this tool the approach has been modified to limit the flow portion routed through a cell depending on the local slope. If a cell is not inclined, no flow is routed through it at all. With increasing slopes the portion of flow routed through a cell becomes higher. Cells with slopes greater than a specified slope threshold route their entire accumulated flow downhill. References: - Freeman, G.T. (1991): Calculating catchment area with divergent flow based on a regular grid. Computers and Geosciences, 17:413-22
